data.title: Members Archive
data.text:
Christopher Peatross is the Founder and CEO of Swift Real Estate Partners, responsible for the firm’s strategic vision and leadership of its investment platform. Christopher founded Swift in 2010, bringing over 34 years of experience in the commercial real estate industry, with expertise ranging from development, leasing and management, to private equity fundraising and investments of large-scale commercial real estate transactions.

Before founding Swift, Christopher was the President and CEO of CarrAmerica, Trizec, and Equity Office Properties (EOP) where he oversaw all aspects of EOP’s 56 million square foot office portfolio, successfully creating one of the nation’s leading real estate companies.

Prior to joining EOP, he served for five years at CarrAmerica as the Northern California Managing Director.

Earlier in his career, Christopher served at Spieker Properties, Catellus Development Corporation, DivcoWest and Hunter Properties.

Christopher and his wife of 22 years, Beverly Jane, reside in Lafayette, CA with their four children, Chandler, Audrey, Charlie and Swift, and their dog, cat, 20 chickens and 300+ honeybees. Christopher and Beverly Jane have endowed scholarships through the Leland Scholars Program (LSP) aimed at aiding first generation, under-resourced and low-income students in making the transition to college.

Christopher earned a Quantitative Economics degree from Stanford University, where he was also a member of the Stanford Cardinal football team. He is a member of ULI and YPO.

Rachel Sergi is Swift’s Managing Director of Finance and Accounting. Rachel oversees the financial, accounting, tax and IT activities of the organization. Prior to joining Swift in 2015, Rachel served as the Vice President of Fund Accounting at Carmel Partners and the Assistant Controller at MBK Real Estate. Rachel began her career at PricewaterhouseCoopers in their real estate division where she was a Senior Associate. Rachel is a California licensed CPA, who holds a degree in Business Economics, with a Minor in Accounting, from the University of California, Los Angeles and an M.B.A. from the Haas School of Business at the University of California, Berkeley.

Doug Abbey is the Chairman Emeritus of Swift Real Estate Partners and joined Swift in 2012. Doug previously co-founded two investment management organizations, AMB Property Corporation (merged with Prologis: NYSE) in 1983, now the largest global industrial REIT, and IHP Capital Partners, formed in 1992, a provider of equity to the single-family homebuilding industry. Doug is a Trustee and past Vice Chairman of the Urban Land Institute and serves as the Chair of the ULI Foundation and on the board of the ULI Terwilliger Center for Housing. He serves on the board of Bridge Housing, the leading non-profit affordable housing developer on the West Coast with over 13,000 units under management. Doug also serves on the real estate committee of the UCSF Foundation. Since 2005 he has taught the real estate class at the Stanford Graduate School of Business. Doug holds a B.A. from Amherst College and an MCP from University of California, Berkeley.

Chris Huizenga is a Director at Swift, responsible for overseeing Operations for the Southern California region, Engineering for Swift’s entire portfolio and is a member of the Swift Management Services leadership team. He is a LEED AP O+M providing leadership and support on Swift’s sustainability efforts. Chris has 25 years of commercial real estate experience spanning multiple disciplines (Asset Management, Financial Analysis & Operations). After joining Swift in August 2016, Chris first served as the Asset Manager in Southern California overseeing ten assets totaling 2.4 million square feet. Prior to joining Swift, Chris was a Director in Asset Management for Hines where his 4 million square foot office portfolio was concentrated in the San Francisco Bay Area. He is an active member of the Urban Land Institute, currently serving as a member of the ULI-OCIE Office & Commercial Local Product Council and the ULI-OCIE Program Planning Committee while also volunteering in the ULI Urban Plan Program. Chris holds a B.A. in Finance from the Eli Broad School of Business at Michigan State University.

Bernadette Kosandiak is Swift’s Assistant Controller. She hails from Adelaide, South Australia, and knew from a very young age that her destiny was to make her home in the U.S.A. In 2011, Bernadette ventured to the U.S. to fulfill her childhood dream. Before joining Swift, Bernadette was the Controller for Diodati Investments, where she oversaw accounting for a multi-dimensional real estate development firm responsible for the construction and management of light industrial commercial condominiums. Prior to Diodati, Bernadette devoted eight-years building her financial experience as Senior Accountant at Accru Harris Orchard in Adelaide where she focused on pension funds and accounting for partnerships, trusts, and multi-country entities. Bernadette studied at the University of South Australia and holds a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration.
